summary: This is an email chain from July 2019 between FBI personnel discussing logistics for interviewing potential victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails coordinate meeting times and locations (West Palm Beach, Miami) for victim interviews scheduled for July 11, 2019, and note that the case agent is traveling to Florida.

persons.name: Victim Specialist
persons.context: Appears to be the sender/recipient of emails coordinating victim interview logistics and services. The signature block identifies them as a Victim Specialist with the FBI Miami Headquarters and Homestead Resident Agency.

persons.name: Case Agent
persons.context: Mentioned as the person who spoke to the Victim Specialist and is traveling to Florida for scheduled victim interviews on Thursday, July 11, 2019.

connections.description: They are FBI colleagues coordinating on the Epstein case, with the Victim Specialist receiving updates from the Case Agent about victim interviews and service requests.

events.title: Scheduled Victim Interviews
events.description: The FBI Case Agent has interviews with potential Epstein victims scheduled for 11 AM and 3 PM. Logistics for meeting with victims after these interviews are being coordinated via email.

events.title: Case Agent Travel to Florida
events.description: The FBI Case Agent is reported to be heading to Florida for the investigation, in advance of scheduled victim interviews.

keyFacts: FBI personnel were actively coordinating victim interviews in the Epstein case as of July 2019.
Interviews with potential victims were scheduled for July 11, 2019, at 11 AM and 3 PM.
The FBI Case Agent was traveling to Florida to conduct these interviews.
The correspondence shows the FBI's Victim Specialist role in providing services and support to potential victims.
The emails indicate operational planning for interviews in both West Palm Beach and Miami areas.
